subject: Real Estate
title: The Greater Fool Theory
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Greater Fool Theory.

hook.text: You buy a house you know is overpriced â€” because you're sure someone will pay even more tomorrow.

buildup.text: The greater fool theory says it's rational to overpay as long as a bigger fool is waiting.

discovery.text: During a bubble, this works beautifully. Every overpriced purchase finds a willing buyer at a higher price.

twist.text: The music stops when the last fool realizes there's nobody left to sell to.

climax.text: The person holding the asset when the chain breaks absorbs all the accumulated losses at once.

punchline.text: The last fool pays everyone else's bill.

quiz.question: What does the greater fool theory depend on?
options: Someone willing to pay an even higher price
